meanings.definition: A slap on the back as a gesture of congratulation or encouragement.
meanings.sent1: After winning the game, he received enthusiastic backslaps from his teammates.
meanings.sent2: During the celebration, there were many friendly backslaps among the group.
meanings.sent3: The backslaps at the party were so frequent that it felt like a rhythmic drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The backslaps of approval echoed through the room, filling him with pride.
meanings.sent5: The loud backslaps resonated with joy and camaraderie.

meanings.definition: To slap someone on the back as a gesture of congratulation or encouragement.
meanings.sent1: He backslaps his friend after a successful presentation.
meanings.sent2: In sports, it is common for teammates to backslap each other after a good play.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly backslaps him after he tells a funny joke.
meanings.sent4: The coach backslaps the players, motivating them for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent5: The father gently backslaps his son on the back, showing his pride.
